text: The Heart of General Robert E. Lee is a 1928 MGM short silent fictionalized film short in two-color Technicolor. It was the seventh film produced as part of Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer's "Great Events" series. ==Production== The film was shot at the Tec-Art Studio in Hollywood.Slide, Anthony. "The 'Great Events' Series". Silent Topics: Essays on Undocumented Areas of Silent Film. Scarecrow Press, 2005, p. 38. ==Preservation Status== The film has been preserved in its entirety at the Library of Congress in Washington, DC.Layton and Pierce 332 ==References== ==External links == * Category:1928 films Category:American films Category:American silent short films Category:Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer short films Category:Silent films in color Category:American biographical films Category:Cultural depictions of Robert E.
